casebody.data:
WESTERN ASSUR. CO. OF TORONTO, CANADA, v. ATLANTIC TRANSPORT CO. et al. DALY et al. v. ATLANTIC TRANSPORT CO. et al. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. December 19, 1921.) Nos. 73, 74. Appeal from the District Court of the United States for the Southern District of New York. Libels in admiralty by the Western Assurance Company of Toronto, Canada, and by Bartle Daly and another against the Atlantic Transport Company and the Director General of Railroads, operating the Philadelphia & Reading Railroad. From adverse decrees, the Director General appeals. Affirmed. Macklin, Brown, Purdy & Van Wyek, of New York City (Pierre M. Brown, of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Burlingham, Veeder, Masten & Fearey, of New York City (Chauncey I. Clark and J. Harvey Turnure, both of New York City, of counsel), for appellee Atlantic Transport Co. Henry. E. Mattison,- of New York City, for appellee Western Assur. Co. Herbert Green, of New York City, for appellles Daly and Wood.

Before ROGERS, MANTON, and MAYER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decree affirmed.
